description: This file implements the core functions for the Ansc Simple Client TCP Object, including creation, initialization, object enrollment, shutdown, and resource management. It defines object lifecycle functions vital for managing TCP client connections and their associated resources within the ANSC framework.

methods.name: ANSC_HANDLE AnscSctoCreate(ANSC_HANDLE hContainerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hOwnerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hAnscReserved)
methods.description: Creates and initializes a new instance of the Ansc Simple Client TCP Object, setting up core object properties and invoking object enrollment and initialization routines.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscSctoRemove(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Destroys the specified TCP client object, performing cleanup activities such as canceling active operations and releasing resources.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscSctoEnrollObjects(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Enrols required auxiliary objects, including optional TLS configurations, into the TCP client object to prepare it for operation.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscSctoInitialize(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Initializes the TCP client object, setting default property values, initializing base class components, and preparing internal state for operation.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscSctoShutdown(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Performs shutdown procedures for the TCP client object, including resetting state, freeing auxiliary objects, and releasing synchronization primitives.
